plugins.name: Figsu
plugins.description: Figsu is a plugin specifically designed to assist designers in quantifying the environmental impact of their webpage designs. This tool calculates the digital 'weight' of your webpage design, as well as the carbon emissions produced. As such, Figsu empowers designers to create webpages that are not only aesthetically appealing and user-friendly, but also environmentally sustainable.
plugins.tagline: Know your design’s climate impact

plugins.name: Figmattack
plugins.description:
Figmattack: Your Ultimate Figma Learning Adventure Starts Here! 🚀


Welcome to the OPEN BETA of Figmattack, the first-ever Figma LMS plugin designed specifically for designers of all levels. Whether you're just starting out or you're a seasoned pro, Figmattack offers an exciting and interactive way to sharpen your skills, take on new challenges, and grow as a designer—all within Figma!


Why Try Figmattack?


1. Gamified Learning Stages 🎮

Explore dungeons with progressively challenging stages—Easy, Medium, and Hard. Each dungeon tests your design skills with hands-on Exercise Stages, engaging Quizzes, and fast-paced Timebox Stages. It’s not just learning, it’s an adventure!


2. Personalized Onboarding

When you start, Figmattack adapts to your current level—beginner, intermediate, or expert. You’ll get personalized challenges that help you improve exactly where you need it most.


3. Curated Knowledge Base 📚

Access a handpicked selection of design resources and insights to support your learning journey. Whether you’re tackling a new concept or refreshing your knowledge, our knowledge base is there to guide you.


Coming Soon to Figmattack!


We’re in OPEN BETA, and that means new features are on the horizon:


  1. Leaderboard: Compete with other designers, track your progress, and rise to the top.
  2. Learning Paths: Follow structured paths that guide you from beginner to expert.
  3. Community Features: Join challenges, share tips, and collaborate with other designers within Figmattack.


Join the Figmattack Community on Discord!


We're constantly improving, and we want you to help shape Figmattack. If you encounter any bugs, have ideas for improvements, or just want to connect with other designers on the same journey, we’d love to hear from you!


Join Our Discord and be part of the growing Figmattack community! Share your experience, give feedback, and help us build the future of design learning together.


Get Started with Figmattack Today!


Don’t wait—join the adventure now and start leveling up your design skills inside Figma! This is your chance to experience Figmattack in its early stages, give your feedback, and watch as new features and stages are added in real-time.


Install Figmattack on Figma and dive into your first design challenge now!


Disclaimer: As we're in OPEN BETA, not all features are available yet, and there may be bugs or areas for improvement. Your feedback is crucial in making Figmattack the best learning tool for designers, so don’t hesitate to reach out and share your thoughts!

accepted.name: Sacha Perathoner
accepted.description: Looking for the perfect fit between Users Needs & Business Objectives.

plugins.tagline: Unlock your design potential

plugins.name: Number to Currency Formatter
plugins.description:
Instant Currency Formatter for Figma 💸

Tired of manually formatting numbers into currency? This plugin does it instantly and effortlessly!


How It Works:

  1. Select any text layer (single or multiple ✨) containing numbers.
  2. Choose a currency (INR, USD, EUR, and more).
  3. See a real-time preview (Also in-words!)
  4. Click Convert—instantly formatted with the correct symbol & separators!



Examples:

🔢 240000 → ₹2,40,000 (INR) → "Two Lakh Forty Thousand Rupees"

🔢 1580.75 → $1,580.75 (USD) → "One Thousand Five Hundred Eighty Dollars and Seventy-Five Cents"

🔢 3499.99 → 3.499,99 € (EUR) → "Three Thousand Four Hundred Ninety-Nine Euros and Ninety-Nine Cents"



Why You'll Love It:

✅ Saves time—no more manual formatting!

✅ Works with multiple currencies & multiple layers.

✅ Ensures accuracy with real-time previews.

✅ Enhances financial designs, invoices, and pricing tables.


Take your Figma workflow to the next level and never worry about currency formatting again! ⚡️


Perfect for designers working with financial data, pricing tables, or invoices. 🚀

accepted.name: Manas Manohar
accepted.description:
Fintech | Product Designer

I love the process of creation. The process of building something new...

plugins.tagline: Format plain digits to currency instantly! — ₹, $, €, £, and more!

plugins.name: Select Below
plugins.description:
This plugin selects all objects below the selected object. It is useful when creating vertically long web designs, such as when you want to add a section in the middle.


・Targets only objects within the same parent frame

・You can exclude objects with specific layer names or objects that exceed a specified width from the selection in the settings.


選択したオブジェクトより下方向にあるすべてのオブジェクトを選択するプラグインです。縦に長いWebデザインを制作するとき、途中でセクションを追加したくなった時などに活躍します。


・同じ親フレーム内のオブジェクトのみをターゲットにします

・設定で、特定のレイヤー名のオブジェクトや、指定した幅を超えるオブジェクトを選択対象から除外することができます。
plugins.tagline: A plugin that automatically selects all objects below the selected object

plugins.name: IconAutomation
plugins.description:
### **Comprehensive Guide to the IconAutomation Figma Plugin**


#### **Introduction**


**IconAutomation** is a powerful tool designed to streamline and automate the process of publishing icons within Figma. By integrating with GitLab CI, this plugin ensures your icon sets are always up-to-date and consistent across all platforms. Whether you're a designer working on a small project or part of a large team managing complex design systems, IconAutomation saves time and effort while eliminating manual workflows.


This plugin is primarily tailored for enterprise scenarios. Our company aims to build an internal icon library using Figma and GitLab as a replacement for Iconfont, which suffers from the following limitations:


- **Management Complexity**: Managing Iconfont requires multiple accounts and frequent importing/exporting between design files, Iconfont platforms, and code repositories.

- **Icon Accumulation**: Over time, unused icons accumulate and are loaded all at once in projects, preventing on-demand loading.

- **Font-Based Limitations**: Font-based icons may render blurry or pixelated on high-resolution screens.

- **Icon Conflicts**: Conflicts can arise when using multiple Iconfont libraries, leading to incorrect icon displays.


IconAutomation addresses these issues by leveraging SVGs to build a scalable internal icon library. Once configured, updating both the icon library and code repository can be done with a single click. Unlike font-based solutions, SVGs enable granular control over icon usage—only the icons actually used in a project are bundled, preventing unnecessary bloat.


#### **Core Features**


- **One-Click Publishing**: Publish icons directly from Figma with a single action.

- **GitLab Integration**: Seamlessly connect with GitLab CI/CD pipelines for automated workflows.

- **Version Control**: Automatically manage semantic versioning in `package.json`.

- **Diff Generation**: Compare current and historical icons to generate detailed change reports.

- **Branch Automation**: Create feature branches, submit merge requests (MRs), and clean up temporary branches automatically.

- **SVG Optimization**: Optimize icon assets for performance using industry-standard tools.


#### **Prerequisites**


- **GitLab Instance**: A deployed GitLab instance (cloud-based or self-hosted).

- **Template Repository**: Deploy the `react-icons` template repository to your GitLab instance.

- **Figma Client**: Install the IconAutomation plugin via Figma's Community portal.

- **Plugin Configuration**: Configure essential settings as outlined below.


#### **Configuration Guide**


##### **GitLab Settings**


- **Domain**: The URL of your GitLab instance (e.g., `https://gitlab.com`).

- **Project ID**: Found under your repository’s **Settings > General**.

- **Access Token**: Generate a token with `api`, `read_repository`, and `write_repository` scopes from GitLab’s **Profile > Access Tokens**.


##### **Figma Plugin Setup**


1. Install the plugin and grant necessary permissions.

2. Navigate to the plugin settings and input your GitLab domain, project ID, and access token.

3. Validate the connection to ensure seamless integration.


#### **Design Specifications**


##### **Page Naming Conventions**


- Pages intended for publishing **must** include the keyword "icon" (e.g., `product-icons`, `system-icons`).

- Only frames under these pages will be processed by the plugin.


##### **Frame Requirements**


- Frames must be named with one of the following suffixes:

- **Outlined**: For icons with stroke-based designs (e.g., `Navigation-Outlined`).

- **Filled**: For solid-filled icons (e.g., `Actions-Filled`).

- **Colored**: For multi-color icons, further categorized as:

- **Light**: Optimized for light backgrounds.

- **Dark**: Optimized for dark backgrounds.


##### **Icon Layer Rules**


- All icons **must** be Figma components (not frames or groups).

- Verify component status by selecting a layer—the top panel should display "Component."


##### **Naming Standards**


- Use **Upper Camel Case** (e.g., `AlertCircle`, `SettingsGear`).

- Append style suffixes (e.g., `AlertCircleOutlined`, `SettingsGearFilled`).

- Avoid special characters (`-`, `_`, spaces) and numeric suffixes unless intrinsic to the icon’s name (e.g., `Star1` is allowed; `Star 1` is invalid).

- Ensure uniqueness within each category to prevent conflicts.


#### **Automated Workflow**


1. **Repository Setup**: Configure GitLab details in the plugin settings.

2. **Local Validation**:

- The plugin checks for naming compliance, duplicates, and structural errors.

- Invalid icons are flagged with actionable feedback.

3. **Branch Management**:

- A temporary branch (e.g., `figma-update-20231001`) is created from `master`.

- Semantic versioning updates `package.json` (e.g., `1.2.0` → `1.3.0` for minor changes).

4. **Diff Analysis**:

- Compares current icons against the latest `master` commit.

- Generates a report detailing additions, modifications, and deletions.

5. **Asset Export**:

- Exports SVGs via Figma’s API and organizes them into folders (e.g., `/outlined`, `/filled`).

- Applies SVGO optimizations to reduce file size.

6. **Merge Request (MR)**:

- Submits an MR with a standardized title (e.g., `[Figma]: add icons`).

- Auto-merges after passing CI checks (linting, build tests).


#### **Best Practices**


- **Consistent Naming**: Adhere strictly to naming conventions to avoid validation failures.

- **Modular Design**: Build icons as reusable components with standardized dimensions (e.g., 24x24px).

- **Version Tracking**: Maintain a `CHANGELOG.md` to document icon updates and deprecations.

- **Performance Checks**: Audit SVG complexity to ensure optimal rendering (e.g., simplify paths for small icons).


#### **Example Scenarios**


##### **Scenario 1: Updating an Icon Set**


1. Add new icons to the `Actions-Filled` frame in Figma.

2. Run the plugin to validate and generate diffs.

3. Submit an MR to deploy changes to production.


##### **Scenario 2: Migrating Legacy Iconfont Icons**


1. Import existing Iconfont SVGs into a `Legacy-Outlined` frame.

2. Use the plugin to publish them as SVGs and update project imports.


#### **Troubleshooting**


| Issue | Solution |

| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

| **Naming Errors** | Check for invalid characters or duplicates using the plugin’s validation tool. |

| **Merge Conflicts** | Resolve conflicts manually in GitLab before re-running the plugin. |

| **API Timeouts** | Increase timeout thresholds in GitLab CI settings or split large icon sets. |

| **SVG Rendering Issues** | Convert strokes to outlines and simplify complex paths in Figma. |


#### **Future Roadmap**


- [ ] **GitHub Integration**: Support publishing to GitHub repositories.

- [ ] **Change Preview**: Display a summary of icon changes before publishing.

- [ ] **Enhanced Error Handling**: Provide contextual error messages with resolution steps.

- [ ] **Progress Tracking**: Add a visual progress bar for long-running tasks.


#### **Additional Resources**


- **Figma Documentation**: [Figma Help Center](https://help.figma.com)

- **GitLab CI/CD Guide**: [GitLab CI/CD Documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/)

- **Community Support**: Join discussions on Figma’s [Community Forum](https://forum.figma.com).
plugins.tagline: This is a plugin that combines Figma + GitLab to achieve automated publication of an icon library.

plugins.name: sticky-color-counter
plugins.description:
Count the number of stickies by color.

Able to calculate the product by giving each color sticky a unique coefficient.

The sum of the product can be viewed.


The following colors of stickies have their own coefficients by default.

  1. blue: 0.5
  2. green: 1
  3. yellow: 2
  4. red: 3
  5. else: 0
plugins.tagline: Count the number of stickies by color.

plugins.name: tinyzine
plugins.description:
tinyzine is a plugin that simplifies zine creation, making the process more intuitive and enjoyable. Whether you're crafting a folded zine or a booklet, tinyzine provides an array of features to enhance your design workflow.


Features:

  1. Create: Effortlessly generate frames and layouts for folded or booklet zines. Customize everything from page size, name, and guides to page count, background, and text color.
  2. Layout: Quickly create a print-ready booklet layout with minimal effort by simply selecting frames sequentially.
  3. Rename: Automatically rename frames to save time, allowing you to generate layouts more efficiently.


Ideal for artists, designers, and DIY creators aiming to bring their zine ideas to life with ease
plugins.tagline: a plugin to streamline your zine creation process

plugins.name: marketgoo copies
plugins.description:
Plugin to sync copies from Google Spreadsheet to Figma.


How it works?

  1. Create a Google SpreadSheet with two columns. The first column is the copy id, the second column the copy value.
  2. Publish the document to the web (File > Publish to the web) and copy the public URL.
  3. In your Figma document, create text layers using the ids in the Google SpreadSheet as names.
  4. Run marketgoo copies plugin and paste the public URL of your Google SpreadSheet document.
  5. All content of the text layers with the same name as the ids in the Google SpreadSheet will be updated with the final copies.
  6. After editing any copy in the Google Spreadsheet document, just run the plugin again to update the copies in Figma.
  7. Running the plugin after selecting any layer, will update only the selected text layers (instead of the whole document).


Features

  • You can use dynamic variables with the notation {{ varname }} in your copies. The plugin will ask you for the final value.
  • You can use the HTML tag <br> to force a line break.
  • Any other HTML tag will be removed in Figma, but used to detect the ranges of all styles in the a text layer. For example: Hello <strong>world</strong>.
  • The "Reset layer names" command is useful to un-sync copies to the spreadsheet document.
  • The "Get missing copies" command list all text layers whose names do not appear in the spreadsheet. Useful to discover and sync new copies.

43175.name: marketgoo copies
43175.description:
Plugin to sync copies from Google Spreadsheet to Figma.


How it works?

  1. Create a Google SpreadSheet with two columns. The first column is the copy id, the second column the copy value.
  2. Publish the document to the web (File > Publish to the web) and copy the public URL.
  3. In your Figma document, create text layers using the ids in the Google SpreadSheet as names.
  4. Run marketgoo copies plugin and paste the public URL of your Google SpreadSheet document.
  5. All content of the text layers with the same name as the ids in the Google SpreadSheet will be updated with the final copies.
  6. After editing any copy in the Google Spreadsheet document, just run the plugin again to update the copies in Figma.
  7. Running the plugin after selecting any layer, will update only the selected text layers (instead of the whole document).


Features

  • You can use dynamic variables with the notation {{ varname }} in your copies. The plugin will ask you for the final value.
  • You can use the HTML tag <br> to force a line break.
  • Any other HTML tag will be removed in Figma, but used to detect the ranges of all styles in the a text layer. For example: Hello <strong>world</strong>.
  • The "Reset layer names" command is useful to un-sync copies to the spreadsheet document.
  • The "Get missing copies" command list all text layers whose names do not appear in the spreadsheet. Useful to discover and sync new copies.

plugins.name: Flow Text Into Components
plugins.description:
“Flow Text Into Components” is a convenient Figma plugin designed to help you easily update text across multiple components in your design projects. This plugin simplifies the process of populating text into components, allowing you to save time and maintain consistency in your designs.


How to Use:


1.Set the text layer names in the master component and ensure the layer names in the instances match.


2.Prepare the text you want to flow into the components, separated by line breaks.


3.Open the plugin and select the group of components where you want to flow the text.


4.Enter the text you want to flow into the plugin.


5.Press the Update button.


If the plugin does not function as expected, check that the layer names in the master component and the instances are aligned. The plugin will not work if the layer names in the instances are inconsistent.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill components with the right text

plugins.name: Paint Mixer - Try for FREE
plugins.description:
Paint Mixer allows you to blend two colors just like in real life, using Kubelka & Munk algorithm to predict how light interacts with mixed pigments under natural light for the most authentic results. Learn More from this video.


Features

  1. Accurately mix two colors using the Kubelka & Munk theory.
  2. Apply the mixed color as a fill or stroke to Figma layers.
  3. Create a 9-step gradient layer and linear-fill layer from the start and end colors.


How to Use

  1. Select the end color from the palette box below.
  2. Rotate the handle clockwise to gradually mix the start color with the end color. Rotate counterclockwise to unmix.
  3. Click the hex code to copy color.
  4. Hover on the dropdown to show more actions (see image 2).
  5. Double-click one of the palettes to change its color.


Tips

  1. Rotate two full revolutions (720°) to completely turn into the end color.
  2. Click 3 dots at the bottom to show more options.
  3. Grabbing the handle further from the center of the wheel gives you more precise control.


Pricing

  1. 10 free actions with full access to all features. Actions include using the mixed color and opening the plugin.
  2. Unlock unlimited access for a one-time purchase.


Credits

  1. This plugin uses spectral.js to handle color mixing which is licensed under the MIT License.
  2. Inspiration from Paper app for iPad.
plugins.tagline: Realistic color blending using Kubelka-Munk theory

plugins.name: Generators & Sync Styles
plugins.description:
Create and Synchronize Local Color and Text Styles


Effortlessly create local color styles from selected frames and rectangles, while also generating global text styles from selected text layers. This plugin streamlines your design process by ensuring consistency across your project.


How it Works:


Selection: Simply select any frames, rectangles, or text layers within your Figma document.

Style Generation: Run the plugin to automatically generate local color styles based on the fill colors of the selected objects. For text layers, global text styles will be created based on the selected text properties.


Synchronization: The plugin intelligently synchronizes identical elements by matching both colors and text styles. Any duplicate styles will be updated accordingly, maintaining a cohesive look throughout your design.


With a clean interface and efficient workflow, this plugin enhances your design efficiency and style management.


Important!

The name of each color style will match the corresponding layer name, while the name of each text style will correspond to the selected text layer name. You can use a "/" in either layer name to organize your styles into groups. All styles will be arranged from largest to smallest based on their size.
plugins.tagline: Effortless style creation and synchronization for your designs!

plugins.name: Paster
plugins.description:
Access advanced pasting functionality with the ability to paste multiple layers simultaneously.


Features

  1. Paste or move layers inside a different frame, maintaining their original positions.
  2. Swap selection with copy, preserving the selection properties.
  3. Replace selection with copy, inheriting the copy properties.
  4. Paste only the properties that matter.


Available properties

  1. Absolute position: supports pasting only x or y.
  2. Auto layout
  3. Corner radius
  4. Effects
  5. Fills
  6. Interactions
  7. Name
  8. Opacity
  9. Rotation
  10. Position (relative): supports pasting only x or y.
  11. Size: supports pasting only width or height
  12. Strokes
  13. Text characters


Soon

  1. Layout grids
  2. Resizing options, like Hug and Fill.
  3. Constraints
  4. Font properties: #TBD
  5. Blend modes
  6. Export settings


Shortcuts

You have to assign them, and it works only on macOS.

  1. Control–Command-C: Copy selection
  2. Control–Command-V: Paste in place
  3. Shift-Control–Command-V: Move in place
  4. Control–Command-S: Swap with copy
  5. Control–Command-R: Replace with copy


Notes

  1. Paste strokes will ignore mixed stroke caps (e.g. rounded + arrow)
  2. Triggering undo after using 'Replace with copy', will prevent the plugin from closing. Reported to Figma - waiting for a solution.
  3. "View logs" is an experimental features available only to "Replace with copy".
plugins.tagline: Choose the properties you want to paste

plugins.name: Masonry tidy up
plugins.description:
A simple plugin to help get the brain waves flowing as you synthesise sticky notes from workshops or brainstorming sessions.


Key features:

  • Scale sticky notes to all be the same width and the text size will scale too, no more randomly large or small sticky notes causing havoc when trying to align things nicely ✨
  • Control how many sticky notes wide you want your tidied bundle to be
  • Set the spacing between sticky notes when they're tidied, and manually adjust this using the built in pink-line spacing tools native to FigJam
  • See the width of your selection so that you can control how the notes will tidy
  • Keep things fresh and explore different perspectives - the order of the notes will randomly change each time, so you're not stuck reading the same top notes from the same person each time you go to synthesise a new group of notes


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

Effortless Style Management in Figma


Take full control of your colors, text styles, effects, and grids with Styles Manager – the ultimate tool for organizing, duplicating, and editing styles in Figma. No more manual copying or messy style structures – streamline your workflow and keep everything structured in just a few clicks!

Batch Selection & Actions

Full Control Over Text Styles

Instant Effect Type Recognition

plugins.name: TagIt: Tags Manager
plugins.description:
TagIt is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of organizing and managing tags for design elements within Figma documents.


Buy me coffee


  • Assign Tags: Easily assign tags to any node in the document, including frames, groups, or individual elements.
  • One-Click Selection: Quickly select all nodes associated with a specific tag with just one click, facilitating easy editing and synchronization.
  • Create and Edit Tags: Create new tags on the fly or modify existing ones to tailor the tagging system to your workflow.
  • Color Customization: Assign colors to tags for visual differentiation and organization.
  • Reorder Tags: Arrange tags in the desired order to maintain organization and hierarchy.
  • CSV Import and Export: Seamlessly import and export tags via CSV files for efficient bulk management.


Example Usage:

  • Tag multiple instances of a design element, such as "Primary Button" across different frames or groups.
  • Use TagIt to quickly select all "primary buttons" with a single click, facilitating swift editing and customization.

accepted.name: Sunny
accepted.description: Solving some of the use cases my team encounters when working in Figma.

plugins.tagline: Assign tags, find and select with tags, modify

plugins.name: Variable Sherlock 🕵️‍♂️
plugins.description:
Variable Sherlock 🕵️‍♂️


Inspect every variable by selecting any layer in your design. Variable Sherlock will get every used variable in the selection, organized by node and specify its:

  1. Variable name
  2. Property applied to
  3. Type of variable
  4. Value of variable
  5. Collection of variable
  6. Library the collection comes from


You can also filter and sort your results to get specific kinds of variables based on name, type, property, etc.


Notes

  1. It can take some time to inspect large selections. If this happens, try to select a smaller amount of layers.
  2. The shown value reflects the value of the variable in the active mode for the layer it is connected to.
  3. Library names can only be shown if the library is imported to the file the plugin is running in. Otherwise, the library name will be left blank.


I'm always trying to improve the plugin. If this was useful for you have any suggestions or find any bug, don't hesitate to send me a message or buy me a coffee!

accepted.name: Rodrigo Díaz Salvadores
accepted.description: Product Desig Engineer living in Stockholm

plugins.tagline: Inspect used variables in your design: name, type, value, collection & library

plugins.name: Text Style Creator
plugins.description:
What This Plugin Does

  1. Creates local text styles from any selected text layer
  2. Preserves all typography variable connections (font family, size, weight, etc.)
  3. Automatically finds and applies styles to all matching text layers in the current page


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer that you want to create a style from
  2. Run the plugin


The text style will be named using the content of the selected text layer

The plugin will automatically apply the new style to all text layers with matching properties


Key Features

Supports all typography variables

Batch processing: select multiple text layers to create multiple styles at once

Intelligent matching: finds all text layers with identical properties


Preserves variable connections for:

  1. Font family
  2. Font size
  3. Font style
  4. Font weight
  5. Line height
  6. Letter spacing
  7. Paragraph spacing
  8. Paragraph indent


Note: Make sure your text layers have the desired properties before creating styles, as these will be preserved in the created style.
plugins.tagline: Create local text styles, preserving variable bindings and auto-applying to matching layers.

plugins.name: Tabletop
plugins.description:
Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management, dice rolling, hidden information, and general usability.


Open the playground Figma file for pre-made cards, tokens, and dice!


Features

  1. Sneak a peek at any card or token by selecting it while it is face-down. You will get a preview of the front of the card in your plugin window.
  2. See how many objects you currently have selected.
  3. Flip any number of cards or tokens that you have selected.
  4. Roll any number of dice that you have selected.
  5. Stack objects - this aligns them horizontally and offsets them by 1px vertically, randomizes the layer order, and flips them face-down.
  6. Shuffle objects - this randomizes the layer order of every object you have selected.
  7. Expand a stack of objects - this lays them out side-by-side and flips them face-up, allowing you to quickly see all objects in a stack.
  8. When you select any object, automatically bring it to the top of the layer hierarchy so it appears on top of other objects.


Custom Card & Token Preparation

  1. Create a card or token component that contains a layer named "Front" and a layer named "Back".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need for that particular card/token.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to manipulate the instances of your cards or tokens!
  4. Optional: Export a PNG image of your "Front" layer, paste it into your component beneath the other layers, and rename it "Preview". This will speed up the preview image that is generated in the plugin when the object is selected.


Custom Dice Preparation

  1. Create a die component that contains at least 2 layers named "Face".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to roll your dice!


Feedback Needed!

I'm actively working on this plugin, so please leave comments with feedback and I'll try to refine and add features accordingly.

accepted.name: Colin Brandt
accepted.description:
Full-time product designer at Microsoft
Free-time game designer

plugins.tagline: Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management and more.

plugins.name: Translate AI
plugins.description:
Translate AI empowers you to effortlessly translate content within your designs using the power of AI. Whether you need to translate entire frames, groups, or components, this plugin streamlines the process, enhancing your design workflow.


Features:

Bulk Translation: Translate all selected content at once, saving you time and effort.

Language Suggestions: Get up to three translation outcomes for better language accuracy.

Versatile Application: Works seamlessly with Frames, Groups, Components, and more.

Important Tips:

Avoid Overloading: Translating excessively large amounts of content at once may cause errors.

Font Selection: Always choose the appropriate font for the language you're translating into to ensure accurate rendering.

plugins.description:
AutoRenamer – AI-Powered Layer Naming for Figma 🚀


✨ Say Goodbye to Messy Layer Names!

Tired of manually renaming layers in Figma? AutoRenamer uses AI to analyze images, understand layer context, and automatically assign meaningful names—making your designs more structured & organized!


🔥 Features:

✅ AI-Powered Naming – Uses Azure AI & Mistral AI to suggest relevant layer names.

✅ Image Analysis – Extracts details from images and renames layers accordingly.

✅ Seamless Integration – Works effortlessly within your Figma workflow.

✅ Saves Time – Focus on design while AI handles layer organization.


⚙️ How It Works:

1️⃣ Select a frame or layers in Figma.

2️⃣ Click "Rename with AI" – The plugin will analyze the layers.

3️⃣ AI suggests optimized layer names instantly!


💡 Perfect for designers & teams who want to keep their Figma files clean and well-organized.

plugins.name: Frame move
plugins.description:
Save time and nerves by automating the organization of frames! This tool allows you to quickly select and transfer necessary elements to a separate page with just one click. Important frames will always be at hand and well-structured, ensuring convenience in work and allowing you to focus on creativity and innovation.


Mark the pages: To select the pages for movement, simply click on the button with the "pin" icon to add the [pin] tag to the required pages.


Organize them in one motion: After marking all necessary pages, click on the "Swap" button. This will automatically create a new page named "All Page [date][time]", containing all the previously marked pages with the [pin] tag
plugins.tagline: Simplify project management: fast migration and perfect organization of frames.

Organize them in one motion: After marking all necessary pages, click on the "Swap" button. This will automatically create a new page named "All Page [date][time]", containing all the previously marked pages with the [pin] tag

plugins.name: Typography Style Guide Creator
plugins.description:
Typography Style Guide Creator is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers streamline their typography workflow by automatically generating text styles from existing designs. Stop manually recreating text styles and let this plugin do the heavy lifting.

With Typography Style Guide Creator, you can transform any frame containing text elements into a complete typography system that's integrated directly into your Figma styles. Simply select a frame with your text designs, run the plugin, and watch as your typography system comes to life.

Key Features


Instant Style Generation: Convert manually created text elements into reusable Figma text styles with one click

Smart Name Recognition: Uses your text layer names as style names for better organization

Duplicate Detection: Intelligently identifies and merges duplicate styles to keep your design system clean

Visual Style Preview: See all created styles in an intuitive interface before applying them

Seamless Integration: Styles are added directly to your Figma document's style library


How It Works


Select a Frame: Choose any frame containing your text elements

Name Your Layers: Ensure text layers have descriptive names (e.g., "Heading/H1", "Body/Regular")

Run the Plugin: Click "Create Styles" to generate your typography system

Done!: Your text styles are now available in your Figma document


Perfect For


Design teams establishing consistent typography systems

Designers converting existing designs into organized style guides

Design system maintainers looking to formalize typography rules

Anyone who wants to save time on manual style creation


Save Hours of Design Work

Typography Style Guide Creator eliminates the tedious process of manually creating and managing text styles. What would normally take hours can now be done in seconds, allowing you to focus on what matters most—designing great experiences.
plugins.tagline: Turn your text designs into organized typography styles with a single click
